      • getKbObject

        public static KbObject getKbObject(String cycLOrId)
                            throws KbTypeException,
                                   CreateException
        Returns a KbObject which is the best representation for a given String, so long as it doesn't need to be created in the KB. This method is useful in cases where you don't necessarily know what kind of input you will receive, such as when parsing user input. It will attempt to return a KbObject according to these basic rules:
        1. If the string is an ID, return the KbTerm or Assertion associated with that ID.
        2. If the string appears to be a CycL variable, return a Variable.
        3. If the string appears to be a CycL keyword, return a Symbol.
        4. If the string appears to be a CycL sentence, return a Sentence.
        5. If the string appears to be a denotational term, return a KbTerm.

        When returning a KbTerm or Assertion, this method will always attempt to return an instance of the most specific subclass possible. For example, "#$WeatherQuantity" will be returned as an instance of FirstOrderCollection.

        This method attempts to follow a least-common-denominator principle of least surprise, but do be aware that some strings may have multiple possible representations as KbObjects. For example, this method will return a Variable for "?X", but that string could also be represented as a KbIndividual; if you want "?X" as a KbIndividual, you could accomplish this via a call to KbTermFactory.get(String) or KbIndividualFactory.get(String). Similarly, almost any string can be a symbol, but the most common type of symbols are keywords, which are prefixed with ":". This method would return a symbol for the string ":SYMBOL", but if you wanted a (non-keyword) symbol for the (un-prefixed) string "SYMBOL", you would need to request it from SymbolFactory.get(String).

        Parameters:
        cycLOrId -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException

      • getSentence

        public static Sentence getSentence(String sentStr)
                            throws KbTypeException,
                                   CreateException
        Attempts to convert a CycL string into a CycFormulaSentence and thus into a KbObject, Sentence.

        Parameters:
        sentStr - the string representing a Sentence in the KB, a CycL sentence
        Returns:
        a Sentence object
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException - if the Sentence represented by sentStr could not be parsed.

      • getSentence

        public static Sentence getSentence(Relation pred,
                   Object... args)
                            throws KbTypeException,
                                   CreateException
        Builds a sentence based on pred and other args. Note that args should be KbObjects, Strings, Numbers, or Dates. This constructor also handles Lists and Sets (and Lists of Lits or Sets of Lists, etc.) of those supported objects.
        Parameters:
        pred - the first argument of the formula
        args - the other arguments of the formula in the order they appear in the list
        Returns:
        a Sentence object
        Throws:
        KbTypeException - is thrown if the built cycObject is not a instance of CycFormulaSentence. This should never happen.
        CreateException

      • getSentence

        public static Sentence getSentence(Object... args)
                            throws KbTypeException,
                                   CreateException
        Builds an arbitrary sentence based on the args provided. Note that args should either be KbObjects or Java classes, String, Number or Date. This constructor also handles java.util.List and java.util.Set of other supported KB API or Java objects. It even supports, List of List etc.
        Parameters:
        args - the arguments of the formula in order
        Returns:
        a Sentence object
        Throws:
        KbTypeException - never thrown
        CreateException

      • getSymbol

        public static Symbol getSymbol(String symStr)
                        throws KbTypeException
        Creates an instance of #$CycLSubLSymbol represented by symStr in the underlying KB.
        Parameters:
        symStr - the string representing an #$CycLSubLSymbol in the KB
        Returns:
        the Symbol representing an #$CycLSubLSymbol in the KB
        Throws:
        KbTypeException - Symbols are created on demand and are not expected to throw any exception

      • getVariable

        public static Variable getVariable(String varStr)
                            throws KbTypeException
        Creates an instance of #$CycLVariable represented by varStr in the underlying KB.
        Parameters:
        varStr - the string representing an #$CycLVariable in the KB
        Returns:
        the Variable representing an #$CycLVariable in the KB
        Throws:
        KbTypeException - if the term represented by varStr is not an instance of #$CycLVariable and cannot be made into one. Symbols are created on demand and are not expected to throw any exception

      • clearCache

        public static void clearCache()
        Clears all caches relating KbObjects to objects on the Cyc server. In most applications, this will not be needed. However, it can be helpful in applications where the KB is modified externally. For example, if a Cyc term is deleted and then recreated with the same name by some external process, the KB API will still have the id information from the old constant, and will retrieve the new constant. A call to clearCache will clear the cache and allow the KB API to successfully retrieve the newly created constant.
